author: donaldp
msg: Attempted to fix some synchronization bugs.
It was possible (and likely) that stop()/dispose() would be ignored and the block would continue on running scheduled events.
It was also possible in very rare circumstances for a newly added event to be ignored if it had close to zero time before it was next scheduled to run. I believe it has been fixed.

author: donaldp
msg: Update sar task to support <classes/> sub element.

author: donaldp
msg: Fixed bug in Packet Acceptor that would cause the PacketManager to block indefinetly when asked to dispose itself.
This was the same bug that occured in SocketManager. Like the bug in SocketManager this was due to differences between socket support between win32 and unix.

author: donaldp
msg: Moved PackageRepository to another package ... packages was too easy to confuse with java packages.

author: donaldp
msg: Made installer add SAR-INF/classes to classpath of application.
